alert.note: Alert for Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 10:28PM EDT until August 25 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following counties, Washtenaw and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1027 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause or aggravate urban and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor new or additional flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ann Arbor, Livonia, Taylor, Romulus, Ypsilanti, Flat Rock, Saline, Milan, Grosse Pointe, Chelsea, Dexter, Manchester, Canton, Downtown Detroit, Detroit, Dearborn, Wyandotte, Trenton, Grosse Ile and Northville. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
